resources.string: Device will be muted on shutdown
Device will NOT be muted on shutdown
Airplane mode will be disabled on shutdown
Airplane mode will NOT be disabled on shutdown
Silent Boot requires additional permissions to mute and un-mute your phone.\n\nPlease enable Do Not Disturb access.
Silent Boot mutes your phone on shutdown to keep it quiet on boot and restores the previous ringer mode after startup is complete.\n

In extended mode other volume levels are muted/lowered as well to support some phones where the classic workaround shows no effect. This might change the phone\'s volume levels if Silent Boot fails to restore the previous values on boot. Only use when Silent Boot does not mute the startup sound.\n
Compatibility mode improves reliability on phones with low memory. It creates a notification that makes it less likely that the app is killed by the system when it\'s running out of memory.\n

Shutting down the phone with airplane mode enabled might prevent Silent Boot from working properly. This option disables airplane mode before shutdown and restores it after startup is complete. THIS WILL BOOT UP YOUR PHONE WITHOUT AIRPLANE MODE! Only enable if you are experiencing issues with Silent Boot and airplane mode!\n
Android requires a notification to run the service that is required to capture the shutdown event
